answers.answer: It sounds more like the beginning of Carpel Tunnel.  You may want to look at the Ergonomics of how you are sitting at the computer.  Its an easy fix.  I had the beginnings of it several years back and once I set my workstation up to be Ergonomic, the problem disappeared.  It came back a couple of years ago and I blame it more on bad posture and sitting habits what playing on the computer at home.Your forearm should not be on the desk when you are on the computer.  You are also most likely putting your arm at a position that will give you temporary tennis elbow or bursitis (sp) and your head is most likely not in the most ideal position which can cause neck pain and shoulder pain.In any case, I would recommend going to a doctor when in doubt.Good luck,Zee
